comments.body: nit: whitespace not required for readability.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +103,107 @@# Access it by going to <master-ip>:9090 and login as vagrant/vagrant
if ! which /usr/libexec/cockpit-ws &>/dev/null; then

  pushd /etc/yum.repos.d
    wget https://copr.fedoraproject.org/coprs/sgallagh/cockpit-preview/repo/fedora-22/sgallagh-cockpit-preview-fedora-22.repo

comments.body: My intention with this conditional was to limit the fixup to Fedora 21.  The fixup appeared unnecessary (and occasionally problematic) for Fedora 22 and 23, at least for libvirt.  Do the opscode boxes for 23 have different configuration from the fedora libvirt image that does not require this block?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +23,27 @@hostnamectl set-hostname ${MASTER_NAME}

if [[ "$(grep 'VERSION_ID' /etc/os-release)" =~ ^VERSION_ID=23 ]]; then
  # Disable network interface being managed by Network Manager (needed for Fedora 21+)
  NETWORK_CONF_PATH=/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/

comments.body: I had a problem with wget being missing on the fedora 23 libvirt image.  Do the opscode boxes include it by default?

@marun Forgot to reply sorry. No, wget doesn't exit under fedora. See above^

> I've test with libvirt but I had to add this dnf install -y wget because the libvirt fedora 23 box doesn't >have wget installed. However I got some errors but I don't know if they are related to libvirt fedora >box or kube:

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +105,109 @@
  pushd /etc/yum.repos.d
    wget https://copr.fedoraproject.org/coprs/sgallagh/cockpit-preview/repo/fedora-22/sgallagh-cockpit-preview-fedora-22.repo
    dnf install -y cockpit cockpit-kubernetes
  popd

comments.body:
The >& syntax is for redirecting fds (like 2>&1)

bash has &> which redirects both 2 and 1 but I find it only tends to cause confusion, as you've just witnessed yourself :-)

I don't really see a problem with `>/dev/null 2>&1`, it's so ubiquitous that it's pretty clear right away what it is doing.
Yeah, I see that more often than >&
